channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Biden condemns Trump's attempt to undercut US democracy
Fauci says he believes Biden and Harris should be vaccinated as soon as possible
President-elect slams lawsuit attempting to overturn election results
item.description: After the Electoral College affirmed his win, President-elect Joe Biden addressed the American people and slammed attempts by President Trump and Republicans to overturn the 2020 presidential election results.

item.title: Putin finally congratulates Biden on US election victory
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin congratulated Joe Biden on his victory in the US presidential election Tuesday, six weeks after the vote and a day after the Electoral College officially affirmed Biden's win.

item.title: US Attorney General William Barr resigns
item.description: William Barr will be leaving his role as attorney general, President Donald Trump tweeted on Monday evening.

item.title: CNN reporter confronts Russian security agent over Navalny poisoning
item.description: CNN joins an investigation by the group Bellingcat that has pieced together how the Russian Security Service followed Russian opposition leader Alexey Navalny and his team throughout a trip to Siberia just prior to his poisoning in August 2020. CNN's Clarissa Ward reports.

item.title: A new vaccine and a soon-to-be president begin turning the page
Funeral homes, morgues grapple with surge in US Covid-19 deaths
item.description: Funeral director Kevin Spitzer has been overwhelmed with Covid-19-related deaths in the small city of Aberdeen, South Dakota.

item.title: Hear from New York doctor after receiving Covid-19 vaccine
item.description: Dr. Yves Duroseau, a frontline worker who is one of the first people to receive the Covid-19 vaccine in New York, tells Don Lemon about how he feels after getting the first dose, and the importance of staying vigilant.

item.title: Japanese 'Twitter killer' sentenced to death for murders of nine people
item.description: A Japanese man dubbed the "Twitter killer" who pleaded guilty to killing nine people in a high-profile mass murder case in 2017 was sentenced to death on Tuesday, the Tokyo District Court Tachikawa branch confirmed to CNN.

item.title: India iPhone factory vandalized after workers claim they weren't paid by Apple supplier
item.description: An iPhone factory in India run by a Taiwanese manufacturer was vandalized over the weekend after workers there claimed they were not being paid their wages, prompting Apple to launch an investigation.

item.title: Most Americans will likely get a Covid-19 vaccine, survey finds
Shut the door on Trump by ending the electoral college
item.description: America's electoral college, an institution rooted in racial slavery, must be abolished.

item.title: Boko Haram claims to have kidnapped Nigerian schoolboys, in unverified audio message
item.description: A man claiming to be a leader of Boko Haram said the terror group was responsible for kidnapping scores of schoolboys in northwestern Nigeria on Friday, according to a short audio message shared with Nigerian media and reviewed by CNN.

item.title: China avoids ICC prosecution over Xinjiang for now, but pressure is growing
item.description: China will not face a case at the International Criminal Court over its treatment of ethnic minorities in Xinjiang -- for now.

item.title: A 'frozen rainforest' of microscopic life is melting Greenland's ice sheet
item.description: When Joseph Cook first landed on the Greenland ice sheet in 2010, he was expecting to see a pristine white environment. What he found was a "colorful patchwork" -- from blacks and grays to greens, purples and browns, with neon blue melt streams cutting through the ice.

item.title: It will take months for vaccines to help the economy
item.description: Here's some sobering news: The International Energy Agency has once again downgraded its forecast for 2021, saying that it will take months for coronavirus vaccines to start reversing the damage caused by the pandemic.

item.title: Ex-GOP governor praises Biden for these two speech moments
item.description: Former Governor of Ohio John Kasich (R) discusses how the Republican Party is feeling after the Electoral College formally affirms Joe Biden's presidential win.

item.title: Australia 'deeply troubled' by reports of Chinese restrictions on its coal
item.description: The trade fight between China and Australia appears to be escalating, with Beijing reportedly placing new restrictions on imports of Australian coal.

item.title: Late-night hosts react to Covid-19 vaccine distribution
item.description: Late-night hosts Trevor Noah, Jimmy Fallon, Stephen Colbert, and James Corden poke fun at the first distribution of coronavirus vaccines in the US.

item.title: North Korean defector says he'll risk jail to defy South Korea's propaganda leaflet ban
item.description: A prominent North Korean defector has vowed to continue sending messages to his homeland -- at the risk of going to prison -- after South Korea banned the launching of propaganda leaflets into North Korea.

item.title: Sharon Osbourne says she was briefly hospitalized with Covid-19
item.description: Sharon Osbourne has revealed she's tested positive for Covid-19.

item.title: Singapore announces plans to allow entry to business travelers from all countries
item.description: Singapore is set to launch a new segregated travel lane for business travelers on short-term stays, Chan Chun Sing, the country's Minister for Trade and Industry announced on Tuesday via a post on his verified Facebook account.

item.title: NASA releases never-before-seen images from Hubble Telescope
item.description: In honor of the Hubble Space Telescope turning 30 this year, NASA and its partners have released never-before-seen images from its three-decade-long career.

item.title: Why tens of thousands of Australians will be stranded abroad this Christmas
item.description: Anxious, angry and abandoned. Less than two weeks from Christmas, at least 39,000 Australian citizens and permanent residents are still stranded overseas due to Australia's international arrival caps.

item.title: Fire at Russian care home kills 11 elderly residents with mobility issues
item.description: Eleven elderly residents were killed in a fire at a care home in Bashkortostan, Russia early on Tuesday morning, according to the state-run news outlet Tass.

item.title: 'Simply unacceptable:' Congressman exiting GOP calls out Trump's racist attacks
item.description: Rep. Paul Mitchell tells CNN's Jake Tapper that he no longer wants to be affiliated with the Republican Party and calls out President Trump's racist attacks.

item.title: Pinterest settles gender discrimination lawsuit for $22.5 million
item.description: Pinterest has agreed to settle a gender discrimination and retaliation lawsuit brought by its former chief operating officer, Francoise Brougher, for $22.5 million.

item.title: Gupta presses official on White House parties: How are we supposed to reconcile this?
item.description: CNN's Dr. Sanjay Gupta presses Health and Human Services Secretary Alex Azar about the multiple White House holiday parties despite the CDC advising Americans not to hold holiday gatherings as the coronavirus pandemic rages on in the US.

item.title: 'A game that 'will go down in history:' Baltimore Ravens beat Cleveland Browns with last-gasp field goal
item.description: It's been a disappointing year for Lamar Jackson and the Baltimore Ravens. But a stunning last gasp 47-42 win against their division rival Cleveland Browns might just spark a thrilling end to the season for the team.

item.title: Mother pleads with government as more than 300 students are missing
item.description: Some 337 students are still unaccounted for after an attack on the Government Science Secondary School Kankara in Nigeria last week, a state government spokesman told CNN. CNN's David McKenzie reports.

item.title: Google delays a return to the office until September
item.description: Google employees won't be returning to the office until September.

item.title: See 104-year-old coronavirus survivor celebrated by hospital staff
item.description: A 104-year-old woman named Elena has survived coronavirus and pneumonia in Madrid, Spain.

item.title: Australia's Byron Bay beaches 'severely eroded' as heavy rain batters the country
item.description: A beach in Byron Bay, a coastal town in in Australia about 100 miles south of Brisbane, has "been significantly eroded" as extremely heavy rain batters much of the country's east coast, according to local officials.

item.title: It's not just doctors and nurses who are getting the first vaccines. Some housekeeping staff are at the top of the list
item.description: The first Pfizer and BioNTech Covid-19 vaccines are here, but it's not just doctors and nurses who are getting them first.

item.title: How skiing helped make world renowned chef
Wisconsin Department of Health warns against eating the 'cannibal sandwich,' a traditional holiday dish in the state
item.description: Wisconsin residents are being urged by health officials to pass on eating a traditional holiday dish this year to avoid getting sick.

item.title: Socially distanced Santa is the best thing to happen to Christmas
item.description: The pandemic's silver linings have been few and far between -- reduced work commutes for some, no racist uncle at Thanksgiving and now socially distant Santa.

item.title: Archaeologists reveal new section of Aztec skull tower
item.description: Archaeologists have uncovered 119 more human skulls on a famous Aztec tzompantli in Mexico City.

item.title: A filter made for astronaut urine could soon be providing drinking water on Earth
item.description: Last month marked 20 years of continuous human presence on the International Space Station (ISS). Scientific research to improve life aboard the ISS has led to countless developments in space technology, but it has also brought benefits to people on Earth.

item.title: A-Lim Kim mounts incredible comeback to win the US Women's Open and clinch her first major
item.description: South Korea's A-Lim Kim staged an incredible final-round comeback to win the U.S. Women's Open in Houston, Texas, and claim her first major title.

item.title: This robotaxi from Amazon's Zoox has no reverse function
item.description: This self-driving robotaxi from Amazon's Zoox can travel up to 75 mph and never has to turn around. Check out this electric vehicle made for crowded city streets.

item.title: The incredible stories behind 5 of the world's most expensive watches
item.description: A little over 30 years ago, Geneva's Antiquorum pioneered the modern watch auction with its "Art of Patek Philippe" sale. Before then, the notion that fine watches were collectable was rather eccentric -- it took the rise of cheap electronic quartz models throughout the 1970s and '80s to distinguish traditionally crafted timepieces as more than just keepers of time.

item.title: After the Electoral College affirmed his victory, the US President-elect said 'the will of the people prevailed'
item.description: President-elect Joe Biden declared Monday, hours after the Electoral College made his victory over President Donald Trump official, that "the rule of law, our Constitution and the will of the people prevailed" over Trump's efforts to undo the results of the election.

item.title: Pompeo to meet Biden's secretary of state nominee this week
item.description: President-elect Joe Biden's pick for secretary of state is expected to visit the State Department and meet with Secretary of State Mike Pompeo on Thursday for the first time since Biden's victory, according to three sources familiar with the planning.

item.title: Congress has the next -- and final -- vote in the 2020 US election. Here's how it works
A new vaccine and a soon-to-be president begin turning the page
item.description: COVID UPDATES: More than 30% of people in Japan want 2021 Olympics canceled, survey finds Google delays a return to the office until September due to pandemic

item.title: US officials scramble to deal with suspected Russian hack of government agencies
item.description: US officials suspect that Russian-linked hackers were behind the recent data breach of multiple federal agencies, including the Departments of Homeland Security, Agriculture and Commerce, but are continuing to investigate the incident, multiple sources told CNN Monday.

item.title: Russian missile drill triggers false alarm at US military base in Germany
item.description: A Russian military exercise triggered an unusual warning at a critical US military base in Germany on Saturday that ballistic missiles had been launched, according to multiple US defense officials.
